messages.message:
:wave: <!here>
I know it's a little after the fact, but there was an incident at Github today that was dropping SSH connections (https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/r3x7x31k7nn1).

If you saw jobs failing with the following error, that'd be why. They state that it's resolved now, so it shouldn't be happening anymore:
```Caused by: hudson.plugins.git.GitException: Command "git fetch --tags --force --progress -- git@github.com:instabase/instabase.git +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*" returned status code 128:
04:24:04  stdout: 
04:24:04  stderr: kex_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
04:24:04  Connection closed by 140.82.114.4 port 22
04:24:04  fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
04:24:04  
04:24:04  Please make sure you have the correct access rights
04:24:04  and the repository exists.```
